The [British] Library respects the intellectual property rights, including moral rights, of rights holders and makes all reasonable effort to contact and consult rights owners, including, where appropriate, communities directly, or via local community organisations. Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. Irrespective of its copyright status, items and/or collections should not be altered or used in ways that might be derogatory to the originating individuals or communities. notesStmt.note: Leaves missing after folio 59, 79, 169. Defective at the beginning. Folio 103 partly mutilated.
Ḥanlein: inscribed in the colophon, 1504: folio 173v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Festival services according to the Ashkenazi rite, translated in Yiddish.

msItem.title: Services for the first day of Pesaḥ
Services for the second day of Pesaḥ
Yotser Shabat ḥulo shel mo῾ed Pesaḥ
Services for the seventh day of Pesaḥ
Services for the last day of Pesaḥ

Services for the second day of Shavu῾ot
Services for the ninth of Av
Services for the first day of Sukot
Services for the second day of Sukot

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi cursive scripts, partially punctuated, of the 15th to 16th century. Menaḥem Alendorf of the latter portion: inscribed with his name, [5]264 (1504): folio 173v.

binding.p: Post-1600. Dark brown leather. Spine: 'Services for Festivals. German. Brit. Mus. Additional 18,695.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: purchased from him on 24 May 1851: inscribed, folio [174v].
